<p><i><b>Lonicera ciliosa</b></i>, the <b>orange honeysuckle</b> or <b>western trumpet honeysuckle</b> is a honeysuckle native to forests of western North America. A deciduous shrub growing to 6&#160;m (20&#160;ft) tall with hollow twigs, the leaves are opposite, oval, 4–10&#160;cm (1.6–3.9&#160;in) long with the last pair on each twig merged to form a disk.
